0x0010.name: LOCKOUT
0x0010.description: The account is currently locked out

0x0040.name: PASSWD_CANT_CHANGE
0x0040.description: The user can't change the password

0x0080.name: ENCRYPTED_TEXT_PWD_ALLOWED
0x0080.description: The user can send an encrypted password

0x0100.name: TEMP_DUPLICATE_ACCOUNT
0x0100.description: It's an account for users whose primary account is in another domain

0x0200.name: NORMAL_ACCOUNT
0x0200.description: It's a default account type that represents a typical user

0x0800.name: INTERDOMAIN_TRUST_ACCOUNT
0x0800.description: It's a permit to trust account for a system domain that trusts other domains

0x1000.name: WORKSTATION_TRUST_ACCOUNT
0x1000.description: It's a computer account for a computer that is running Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Workstation, NT 4.0 Server, 2000 PRO or 2000 server and is a member of this domain

0x2000.name: SERVER_TRUST_ACCOUNT
0x2000.description: It's a computer account for a domain controller that is a member of this domain

0x10000.name: DONT_EXPIRE_PASSWORD
0x10000.description: The password for this account will never expire

0x40000.name: SMARTCARD_REQUIRED
0x40000.description: The user must log on using a smart card

0x80000.name: TRUSTED_FOR_DELEGATION
0x80000.description: The service account is trusted for Kerberos delegation

0x100000.name: NOT_DELEGATED
0x100000.description: The security context of the user will not be delegated to a service even if the service account is set as trusted for Kerberos delegation

0x200000.name: USE_DES_KEY_ONLY
0x200000.description: Restrict this principal to use only Data Encryption Standard (DES) encryption types for keys

0x400000.name: DONT_REQ_PREAUTH
0x400000.description: This account does not require Kerberos pre-authentication for logon

0x1000000.name: TRUSTED_TO_AUTH_FOR_DELEGATION
0x1000000.description: The account is enabled for delegation. The user or computer account must be explicitly configured with the Trusted for Delegation setting when delegation is a controlled use authorization

0x04000000.name: PARTIAL_SECRETS_ACCOUNT
0x04000000.description: The account is a read-only domain controller (RODC). It is a security-sensitive setting
